title: OPEC says to reconvene meeting with U.S. on deal to cut oil output
text:
October 10, 2017 /  5:27 AM / 2 years ago
OPEC says to reconvene meeting with U.S. on deal to cut oil output
1 Min Read
NEW DELHI (Reuters) - The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC) will reconvene a meeting with the United States for a deal to cut oil output, the cartelâ€™s Secretary General Mohammed Barkindo said on Tuesday.
OPEC and the United States agree they need to work together to ensure stability in oil markets, Barkindo said on the sidelines of the India Energy Forum by Ceraweek in New Delhi.
Reporting by Nidhi Verma; Editing by Malini Menon
